ref: 8350 *pūliya ʻ rotten ʼ. [Cf. pūˊlya -- n. ʻ shrivelled grain ʼ AV., pulāka -- 2 m. ʻ shrivelled or bad grain ʼ Mn., Pa. pulaka -- m. ʻ a shrivelled grain ʼ, Pk. pulāga -- , ˚āya -- m.n. ʻ poor tasteless food consisting of chick -- peas and dry grain ʼ. -- If not of IE. origin (Lith. pūˊliai ʻ pus ʼ, &c. EWA ii 326), then poss. conn. with words for ʻ hollow ʼ s.v. *pōḍa -- ]
Kho. púli ʻ rotten, addled ʼ BelvalkarVol 94, (Lor.) pulik ʻ to become addled or rotten or crumbly or worn out (as egg, stone, wood, clothes), be lost (as a sum owed) ʼ. -- Or < prálīyatē?
